data.title: Matias Almeyda Training Center
data.meta_description: Learn more about Matias Almeyda Training Center. A Soccer facility located in Houston, TX
data.text:
Play Soccer Houston ðâ

Facility Spotlight Series: Houston Soccer Network

Get to know our Houston pickup expansions:

â½ Matias Almeyda Training Center â½

Premier indoor/outdoor complex founded by a former pro! ð¥

Address: 4211 Clow Rd, Houston, TX 77068

Phone: (832) 286-1410

Website: Matias Almeyda Center Website

Instagram: @matiasalmeydatc

Hours Of Operation:

Monday â Friday | 9 am â 9:45 pm

Saturday | 9 am - 5 pm

Sunday | 9 am - 7 pm

Overview:â

Way back in July 2019, the Plei App expanded outside Florida for the first time, partnering with multiple facilities in Houston, Texas. ð We are excited to announce a brand-new partnership, this time with the Matias Almeyda Training Center! As part of an ongoing blog series, we will be highlighting all of our partner facilities in every region where Plei has touched down. ð¬

Ever wanted to experience playing at a soccer facility founded by a former professional player? ð¤©

You can get that experience over at Matias Almeyda Training Center, a full-fledged indoor and outdoor complex in Northwest Houston, established in 2017 by - you guessed it - MatÃ­as âEl Peladoâ Almeyda. ð

In his 20-year playing career, the Argentine - who played as a defensive midfielder - suited up for a number of teams across Europe and South America, most notably River Plate, Sevilla, Lazio, Parma and Inter Milan. ð²

He also appeared in two World Cups for La Albiceleste. ð¦ð·

Following retirement, Almeyda decided to take up managerial duties, beginning with River Plate. Throughout his coaching career, he has already experienced plenty of success, winning titles at nearly every club he represents. ð

In 2018, he became head coach of the San Jose Earthquakes in the MLS, coinciding with the grand opening of this Houston facility. ð

Today, he manages AEK Athens in the Greek Super League. ð¬ð·

His decision to found a soccer complex in the United States comes from his love for the beautiful game and his passion for developing future talents starting from a young age. And what better way to go about this than to open your own facility in the country youâre actively coaching a pro team in? ð

The Matias Almeyda Training Center (MATC) is truly a work of art. ð¨

Boasting a total of five (5) fields, this facility has turned into a hub for local talents to improve their game as well as their chances of getting to the next level. ð

Four of these five fields are located in the vast outdoor space. Here youâll find:

Two (2) full-sized artificial turf fields

One (1) 7v7 artificial turf field

One (1) natural grass stadium field

Head into the facilityâs clubhouse and youâll find one (1) mini field best suited for kids. ð¶

*For now, the Plei App will be offering games on the 7v7 field, so be sure to open the app so you donât miss out!*

The best part is that Almeyda didnât just open the complex, stamp his name on it, and leave. Since its establishment, heâs been involved in every step of the academyâs development, arriving to oversee operations every now and then in his free time. ð«¡

He also hand-picked every member of the coaching staff, who all follow the same concepts and instructional systems put forth by Almeyda. âï¸

This elite coaching group consists of former players with experience in 1st Division Leagues, Youth Farm Development Teams, and internationally-competitive games including Copa Libertadores. â¨

Alemydaâs played for and managed some of the biggest clubs in Argentina, Italy, Spain, Mexico and now Greece, seeing success wherever he went, so thereâs nobody more equipped for the job of developing future talent. ð

The MATC offers a total of four (4) youth programs, each guaranteeing play time, professional-level practice routines and high-quality coaching. ð

These programs are:

Little Kickers (U5)

Little Lions (U7-U12)

Advanced Academy (U13-U15)

Pro Academy (U16-U17)

For more information on all the offerings and amenities at the Matias Almeyda Training Center, check out their website or contact them directly via phone at (832) 286-1410 or via email at info@mafcacademy.com. ð©
